contextId.occurrenceNote: Another possible translation is, "every knee will flow with water," a euphemism for all the people losing control of their bladders because they are so frightened. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: every knee will be weak as water

contextId.occurrenceNote: Possible meanings are 1) this is a polite way to say the young woman was sleeping with the male figures. Alternate translation: "you slept with them" or 2) this is a metaphor in which Yahweh speaks of her worshiping the figures as if she were sleeping with them. Alternate translation: "you worshiped them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: you did with them as a prostitute would do

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to accepting someone to sleep with her. Alternate translation: "you accept strangers into your bed instead of your husband" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-explicit]])
contextId.glQuote: you accept strangers instead of your husband

contextId.occurrenceNote: The euphemism "to end them" refers to killing them. Alternate translation: "in order to kill them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This is a euphemism that means to kill. Alternate translation: "kill" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
This is a euphemism that means to kill. Alternate translation: "kill" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])

"every knee will be as weak as water." This is a euphemism for people being so afraid that they lose their bladder control and urinate on themselves. Alternate translation: "every leg will be wet with urine" or "everyone will lose control of their urine" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: every knee will flow like water

contextId.occurrenceNote: This means that a son sleeps with his father's wife. Alternate translation: "there are men who sleep with their father's wife" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
contextId.glQuote: men uncover the nakedness of their father

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "fall" is a euphemism for "die." The word "sword" is a metonym for soldiers who kill with swords. Alternate translation: "men will kill your survivors with their swords" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: your survivors will fall by the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "fell" here is a euphemism for "died." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-euphemism]])
